page.title: 20ECOLOGY OF BUTTERTON
page.content: Butterton has its own small village, surrounded by greenery. I found that the hedges at the roads have densely overgrown with marsh marrigolds, nettles and tall grass. The roads are about 4 metres wide, because hardly any cars use it. There are several fishing ponds in the area. There are many types of birds, including swallows and lapwings. This is because of the swamps around the area. The air is very clean, but when you go past the farms you can hardly breathe because of the smell of pig manure. Butterton is a beautiful piece of countryside and I hope it will stay like that.
